Has anyone talked to you about the option of perinatal hospice? Its like hospice care for older people, but for young babies who are not expected to live very long. Its focused on comfort measures for your baby, so she doesn't suffer and giving you and her as much time together as possible.  Most parents find it very healing because you still get to spend time with your child and treats both of you with respect and dignity in a heartbreaking situation. You can find more info about how it works, parent testimonials and find programs in your area at www. perinatal hospice .org.  My heart goes out to you Mama, I'm sending many prayers your way. I've done presentations on this for.healthcare students in various fields  classes, and have talke

I would try to get more information. At 24 weeks she might make it. At 28 she would survive. At 32 she would survive and thrive for sure. I would think strict bed rest until labor is unavoidable would be an option. I would hope termination wouldn't be a primary choice for any care provider. Have you tried a different hospital?

I have heard so many stories where the second opinion changes everything. Please do not loose hope. Do you remember that story of baby who was born at 24 weeks and the father his taped his journey all the way up to his first birthday ? It is possible. BE STRONG.

Sorry, my phone again....Perinatal Hospice is a fairly new healthcare trend, so many docs don't know about it. If you have any questions, feel free to messege me, if I can't answer them I can get you in contact with someone who can.

question: Yesterday April 3rd i woke up feeling great. It was my birthday and i was going to celebrate with my family. I got a call from my doctor that i have a short cervix and i need to go to the hospital right away. Long story short i found out that i have an incompetent cervix. The only choice i had was to terminate my healthy baby girl. Im 22 weeks and at this time an emergency cerclage wasnt going to solve my problems.Still at the hospital and im pondering how come my doctor did not catch this sooner like around 12-13 weeka of my pregnancy?? My husband and i are so upset and just left with why....our first pregnancy, our first child .....everything was perfect and still is because she's healthy ...i see her on the u/s and shes great it just feels so wrong to let her go. Why didnt my doctor catch this. I always said my visits were short and not very informative. She always seemed in a rush.I just cant go thru with this
title: short cervix part two: no good news
